text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to show
you how to make a very basic pie crust
now this is my go-to recipe that I've
been using for years and years and you
know over throughout the fall in winter
months you will see me use this a whole
lot this is the base for my pumpkin pie
apple pie I mean you name it this is a
recipe I go for the ingredients are very
simple all you're gonna need is some
all-purpose flour vegetable shortening
unsalted butter salt and very cold water
the key to making an excellent excellent
buttery flaky crust is to have your
ingredients extremely cold even the
flour and the salt I was I put it in the
refrigerator for about an hour and then
the ice the ice the water I had in the
freezer for about 10 minutes until it's
nice nice and cold and the butter I cut
it into cubes while it was really cold
to begin with and I cut it into little
cubes and put it back in the fridge just
so that those cubes were really harden
up as well now you're gonna work really
really quickly I'm doing this in the
food processor because I think it's the
best way to do it but you could do it by
hand the only problem is that if you do
it by hand using your actual hands and
your fingers the warmth of your hands
will kind of soften the butter and that
will make so that will make it so that
the dough is not very flaky at all so
this is really your best bet so in here
I'm gonna put the flour in a salt I'm
gonna turn it on to just pulse it really
quickly so that those two things are
mixed together I am now going to add my
shortening and my butter and I'm going
to pulse about ten times until the
butter is about the size of peas and
it's just distributed all the way
through the flour
now what I'm going to do is with a
tablespoon measure I'm going to go
through the little opening here I'm
going to pulse and put it in your going
to need between three to five
tablespoons over I think I'm going to
stop around one more this is how you
know when you're in business you take
your dough you pinch it it stays
together beautifully you know you're
good to go
now all I'm going to do and you notice
I'm working very very quickly because I
want to keep everything as cold as
possible because now this is going to
have to be rolled into a little ball or
a disc whichever you want to do and this
is enough for one 9-inch pie crust but
what I do and what I suggest you do is
make two to three times the amount and
then divide it and then keep it in the
freezer you know roll it out keep it in
the freezer so you're ready to go that
way if you want to make like an apple
pie or something you know you're ready
if you want to make a pumpkin pie you're
ready now all you want to do is cover
this with plastic wrap and if you were
to use it right away you couldn't you
have to wait at least 30 minutes in the
refrigerator for the gluten to kind of
relax and for everything to get nice and
cold again here we go and that is it
that is basic pie crust and I guarantee
you if you use this recipe and you use
my method of all your ingredients
extremely cold and working very very
quickly this is going to be your go-to
recipe because it's easy it's no fail I
mean it takes minutes to make and all I
do is keep them just like this in the
freezer stash away three or four of them
and then any time I want a fresh pie or
something get out of the freezer put it
in the fridge just till the frost while
you're at work and then that night you
can make a fresh pie for your guests and
don't think you've been slim in a way to
make that pie crust all day but you're
not know the truth now that's it this is
gonna go into the fridge and I'm done
probably wait for me till tomorrow to
make a pie with it
I hope you guys have enjoyed spending
time with me go to my website at
www.att.com/biz
you print it out make it and I guarantee
it you may love it
see ya
